englishTranslation: Someone else will have everything.
Someone had already done that.
vocabIncluded: había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Ella estaba haciendo lo que nadie había hecho.
englishTranslation: She was doing what nobody had done.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ese día, estaré haciendo algo por ti.
englishTranslation: That day, I'll be making something because of you.
vocabIncluded: estaré: "will be", "I will be" (Estar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ese día, habías hecho algo *as* un favor.
englishTranslation: That day, you had done something as a favor.
vocabIncluded: habías: "had", "you had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: I'm doing that with you.
They had been with you (formal).
vocabIncluded: habían: "had", "they had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person plural)
usted: formal "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

englishTranslation: They had said that it was intended for me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
habían: "had", "they had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Me *she told* que no nos *they know.*
englishTranslation: She told me that they don't know us.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

englishTranslation: I hadn't wanted to do that.
vocabIncluded: había: "had", "I had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 1st person)

englishTranslation: We hadn't been here.
vocabIncluded: habíamos: "had", "we had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 1st person plural)

englishTranslation: She won't have done anything.
vocabIncluded: habrá: "will have", "he/she/it will have" before a participle (Haber, future, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: No, now it's very dangerous.

spanishExample: Nos *he told* que no habías estado conmigo.
englishTranslation: He told us that you hadn't been with me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
habías: "had", "you had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 2nd person)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: Para ese día, ella lo habrá hecho.
englishTranslation: By that day, she will have done it.
vocabIncluded: "para": "by" a moment in time, as in "by then"
habrá: "will have", "he/she/it will have" before a participle (Haber, future, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: By then, she will have told them.
vocabIncluded: "para": "by" a moment in time, as in "by then"
habrá: "will have", "he/she/it will have" before a participle (Haber, future, 3rd person)
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Por favor, *tell* me si él es más *smart* que ellos.
englishTranslation: Please, tell me if he is smarter than them.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Sí le *we told* que *he go* con nosotros.
englishTranslation: We DID tell him to go with us.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
sí: adverb meaning "indeed" or otherwise providing positive emphasis

englishTranslation: We all had been with them(f).
vocabIncluded: ella: "them" after a preposition (fem. prep. pronoun)
habíamos: "had", "we had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 1st person plural)

englishTranslation: You(formal) will be doing something else.
vocabIncluded: estará: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Estar, future, 3rd person)
usted: "you", formal subject pronoun, taking 3rd-person treatment

spanishExample: Yo estaba siendo bueno con ellos.
englishTranslation: I was being good(m) with them(m).

spanishExample: Yo sí había hecho lo que *I wanted* hacer.
englishTranslation: I HAD done what I wanted to do.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
había: "had", "I had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 1st person)
sí: adverb meaning "indeed" or otherwise providing positive emphasis
